subject: Gardening
title: Seasonal Color Planning
description: A short lesson to help you apply Seasonal Color Planning.

hook.text: Most gardens peak for two weeks, then look dull for 50. Great designers spread color across all four seasons.

buildup.text: Seasonal planning layers bulbs, perennials, annuals, shrubs, and trees so something blooms or colors in every month.

discovery.text: Winter interest comes from bark (birch, dogwood), berries (holly, viburnum), and structure (grasses, seed heads).

twist.text: The hardest season to design for is late summer, when spring performers are spent and autumn hasn't started.

climax.text: A garden that looks good in every month is the ultimate design challengeâ€”and the mark of a true professional.

punchline.text: Designing for 12 months beats designing for 2 weeks.

quiz.question: What is considered the most challenging season to design color interest for?
options: Early spring when snow has just melted
Late summer when spring performers are finished and autumn hasn't begun
